author: Special Correspondent
text:
Former Chairman of Puducherry Planning Authority K.S.P. Ramesh, one of the key functionaries of the ruling All India NR Congress, on Friday quit the primary membership of the party in protest against alleged sabotage of his electoral aspirations by a section of the AINRC leaders.

Mr. Ramesh faces a criminal case booked by police on charges of sexually assaulting a minor girl. Following the registration of a criminal case, he resigned from the post of Chairman of Puducherry Planning Authority last December. He is currently on bail.

He tendered his resignation to Chief Minister and party president N. Rangasamy.
title: K.S.P. Ramesh quits AINRC
